question: A sperm is composed of a head, neck, a middle piece, and a ______.
The whole body of the sperm is enveloped by a ______ membrane.
The anterior portion of the sperm head is covered by a cap-like structure called the ______.
The acrosome is filled with ______ that help fertilisation of the ovum.
The middle piece of sperm contains numerous ______ which produce energy for movement.
The movement of the sperm tail is essential for ______.
During a single coitus, about ______ million sperms are ejaculated.
For normal fertility, at least ______ per cent of sperms must have normal shape and size.
For normal fertility, at least ______ per cent of sperms must show vigorous motility.
Sperms are transported by the ______ ducts after release from seminiferous tubules.
Secretions of epididymis, vas deferens, seminal vesicle, and ______ are essential for sperm maturation.
The seminal plasma along with the sperms constitutes the ______.
Functions of male sex accessory ducts and glands are maintained by ______ hormones.
Testicular hormones are also called ______.
The process of formation of a mature female gamete is called ______.
Oogenesis is initiated during the ______ development stage.
A couple of million gamete mother cells called ______ are formed within each fetal ovary.
No more oogonia are formed and added after ______.
Oogonia start division and enter into ______ of the meiotic division.
Oogonia get temporarily arrested at prophase-I stage and are called ______.
Each primary oocyte gets surrounded by a layer of granulosa cells and is called the ______ follicle.
A large number of primary follicles degenerate during the phase from ______ to puberty.
At puberty only ______ primary follicles are left in each ovary.
The primary follicles get surrounded by more layers of granulosa cells and a new theca and are called ______ follicles.
The secondary follicle soon transforms into a ______ follicle.
The tertiary follicle is characterised by a fluid filled cavity called ______.
The theca layer of the tertiary follicle is organised into an inner ______ and an outer theca externa.
The primary oocyte within the tertiary follicle grows in size and completes its ______ meiotic division.
The first meiotic division in the tertiary follicle is an ______ division.
The unequal division results in the formation of a large haploid ______ oocyte.
The unequal division also produces a tiny first ______ body.
